title: Dorsett Hospitality International collaborates with Lai Yuen Amusement Park
text:
Dorsett Hospitality International collaborates with Lai Yuen Amusement Park Dorsett Hospitality International collaborates with Lai Yuen Amusement Park Details Category: Special Offers   10:30 Summer gets better and better with Dorsett=Choice Campaign. Be it for family vacation, business travel or simply looking for value deals, check out the various Dorsett=Choice campaign offers*. For families, book two rooms and enjoy the 2nd room at 50% off whilst value seekers will appreciate the 20% off Best Available Rate and business travellers will enjoy extra value adds such as FREE upgrade to next room category, breakfast for up to 2 persons and up to 2 pieces of laundry per day per room. The Dorsett=Choice campaign ends on 30th September 2015. 
For thrill seekers, Dorsett International is now working with Lai Yuen Amusement Park to bring sizzling hot fun for all guests who stay at any Dorsett or Silka hotels in Hong Kong. Guests can enjoy free token offer to Lai Yuen Amusement Park for stays on or before 31 August 2015 to experience the childhood favourites of Hong Kongers. For every room reservation made via www.dorsett.com; guests will receive 8 FREE tokens. Requests for tokens must be made at point of room reservation. Lai Yuen Amusement Park which closed its doors in 1997, makes a comeback as a pop-up carnival event in Central, Hong Kong. Originally located in Lai Chi Kok, it was the first ever-large-scale and iconic theme park built in 1949 where a variety of rides and a private zoo could be found. As Lai Yuen Amusement Park is part of the collective memories of many Hong Kongers, the comeback after 18 years provides tourists an opportunity to embrace the genuine childhood happiness and the very Hong Kong culture. The pop-up fair features a selection of 10 vintage favourites including Lai Yuen Castle, Gum Tiles, Merry-Go-Round and more. The Super TINO elephant, the symbol of Lai Yuen Amusement Park, and other wild animals are recreated by using state-of-the-art technology and large balloons made of environmentally-friendly materials so as to transport guests to the land of old times.
